text: <@U1F97K1UJ|mack> has joined the channel
Hi <@U0UHG4VP1>
Binhn asked me to disable jenkins on hyperledger/fabric as we are seeing false build failures..
doesn’t seem like a great idea.
Shall we test this using my fabric repository?
<https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/view/fabric/job/fabric-github-verify-x86_64/>
<https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/view/fabric/job/fabric-github-verify-z/>
a couple have passed now
I set the discard time to 1 minute for x86_64 builders (was 10 minutes) and I’m running a script to fix the issue with the Z builds
the big problem is the permissions issue <@U0KPFAZNF> is working on, so this works around that
Shall we disable build notifications back to github?
we can enable once all issues fixed.
I think that would have been reasonable yesterday
<@U0KM61BCP>: <@U0KN2SSKE>: now that jenkins votes have a workaround for structural issues (the file permission problem that’s been plaguing us) do you still want the jobs disabled?
<@U0UHG4VP1> <@U11HH3P7Y> I’ve noticed something curious
this might be a github bug and nothing to do with us, but….
if you look at a PR that has successfully run CI, click on the CI details, and then hit the back arrow, github will have changed its tune
it will say they all failed
(at least, it does on my system)
disabled jenkins for now
(note that this is across the board…travis and jenkins/[z,x86]
If you refresh the page is it still failed?
looks
no, refresh fixes it
Weird
its probably some kind of glitch in the github UI
Seems likely
not restoring some kind of state in the history mechanism
so whats the latest?  i seems both 1836 and 1840 fix the problem?
but I also saw you mentioned something about shutting jenkins down for now
I think they should be merged (well, one of them)
Then the pending prs should be rebased
